Jason Bourne.Action: Despite being badly wounded with a gunshot and multiple injuries, Bourne successfully breaks into a pharmacy and gathers medical supplies to treat himself.
Uses specific medical supplies like penicillin, surgical tools, and vicodin, indicating knowledge and skill in self-treatment under pressure.
Hides in shadows and moves cautiously despite injuries, demonstrating tactical awareness and survival instinct.
Treats his own wound carefully and methodically, showing self-care.
Does not respond to police commands and immediately disables an approaching policeman to avoid capture.
Opens capsules of penicillin and pours powder directly into his wound, begins treating himself.
Finishes self-treatment, splashes water on face, appears a man on a mission.
Does not respond to police commands, waits calmly and then quickly grabs gun and disables a policeman in one motion.
Tells Policeman #2 in Russian, 'My argument is not with you,' before taking his gun and disabling him.
Freezes Policeman #2 with his gun and a look rather than shooting immediately.
Does not harm Policemen beyond disarming them and smashing the radio to prevent communication.
Puts a gun to Abbott's head but chooses not to kill him because 'She wouldn't want me to.'
Forcefully confronts Abbott, putting a gun to his head but chooses not to kill him, showing restraint based on personal values.
Confronts and intimidates a corrupt official leading to that official's suicide, demonstrating effectiveness and impact.
Keeps part of his memory and motivations unclear to adversaries, maintaining an element of strategic ambiguity.
Remains a serious threat with a complex, elusive trail spanning multiple countries indicating persistent high-level evasion and survival skills.
The death of Marie Kreutz, a person close to him, might imply a failure to protect those around him, signaling a potential negative indicator.
Tells Martin Kreutz that his sister (Marie) is dead and was killed.
Bourne nods when Martin says he killed the man who came for him, accepting responsibility.
Bourne states he will find who started all this, implying a sense of justice and responsibility.
Bourne knocks aside a bodyguard and shoves Ellatrache against the wall to get information.
Demands answers aggressively, showing intolerance for evasion, pushing hard for info.
Confidently confronts and intimidates a bodyguard to extract critical information despite personal risk.
Shows clear focus and determination to find the person responsible for the conspiracy behind Treadstone.
Does not hesitate to use physical force strategically to achieve his goals.
Leaves Martin's apartment decisively after gathering what he needs, demonstrating clear purpose.
Reads The Guardian article about himself and Marie attentively, processes personal loss and uses it as motivation.
Finds Simon Ross's name and immediately investigates further by checking the news department.
Burns Marie's belongings, demonstrating emotional pain but also decisiveness in moving forward.
Surreptitiously puts a phone into Ross's pocket to initiate contact without raising suspicion.
Buys a cell phone and quickly activates it, then disposes of the packaging to avoid detection.
Blends into the crowd and approaches Ross unnoticed.
Puts a phone into Ross's pocket without him noticing, effectively planting a tracking or communication device.
Uses the planted phone to communicate covertly, instructing Ross without giving away information.
Pretends to be a drunk to avoid detection and follows Ross quietly, showing restraint and subtlety.
Stops Ross and questions him about an article and his knowledge of Bourne, showing concern about who is following Ross and the trouble it might bring.
Blends into the crowd by pretending to be a drunk to avoid detection while following Ross.
Listens in discreetly to a chaotic situation far away, showing ability to multitask and gather intelligence.
Stops Ross and directly questions him about sensitive information, taking initiative to uncover details.
Warns others to get into cover quickly to protect them
Instructs to keep moving and be faster to avoid danger
Commands others to get into the store to create a diversion and protect
Silently takes out agents pursuing Ross and directs her to keep moving through safe routes.
Instructs Ross firmly to stay calm, listen exactly to his instructions, and stay behind the door for safety.
Keeps Ross on the phone to provide guidance and protect him from harm.
Takes out all his agents and grabs Robb, demonstrating combat skill and control.
Calmly instructs Ross to stay calm and do exactly what he says, ensuring cooperation and control under pressure.
Exits behind the silver door, stays on phone with Ross, uses crowd to hide from CCTV while monitoring approaching agents, demonstrating situational awareness and tactical thinking.
Instructs Ross to stay behind the door and not move, showing concern for his safety.
Observes the agents pulling back and senses something is wrong, indicating attentiveness but no direct emotional expression.
Orders Ross to stay put and not move until told; detects something suspicious despite appearances.
Actively scans the rafters for threats, demonstrating situational awareness.
Correctly suspects a setup when agents pull back and Ross wants to run, showing intuition and caution.
Bourne goes to Ross' body immediately after the shooting, feeling for something on it.
Ducks behind the crowd to avoid being seen by Paz, avoiding unnecessary confrontation.
Ducks behind the crowd to avoid Paz's line of sight after the assassination attempt.
Feels Ross' body for something immediately after Ross is shot.
Watches Paz with a reflective, almost empathetic gaze as if seeing his old self
Relentlessly pursues Paz in a crowded station, showing single-minded focus
Pages through the ROSS notebook, identifies key names and places, uses internet research to trace leads (Sewell and Marbury, Blackbriar, receipt from Madrid).
Leaves the internet cafe after conducting research, showing decisiveness and focus.
Avoids capture and appears at a high-security location without being detected, showing ability to stay ahead of pursuers.
Confronts powerful figures and threatens serious consequences (burning down a house) to get answers.
Moves unexpectedly and quickly, causing others to have little time to react, implying tactical awareness and skill.
Rings the bell at Sewell and Marbury's front door, stays observant and leaves quietly when no answer; avoids confrontation with cops.
Avoids using traceable communication methods such as cell phones while meeting his source, demonstrating operational security.
Is initially suspected to have met Ross for breakfast in Turin but logic and evidence quickly disprove the assumption, indicating Bourne's careful planning to avoid detection.
Picks the lock and gains entry to Sewell and Marbury covertly and without alerting anyone.
Finds the office, jimmies the door, and disables the alarm efficiently.
Noticed signs of a hurried exit indicating good observational and analytical skills.
Checks the office carefully and soon finds a photo of Daniels with Albert Hirsch.
Remembers and experiences a flashback that overwhelms him, indicating vulnerability to past trauma.
Silently listens from hiding spot, avoids confrontation initially.
Surprises and quickly incapacitates Hammond and Kiley without warning.
Yanks the headsets and closes the phone, cutting off communication to protect himself.
Hesitates before shooting Nicky, recognizing her and showing restraint.
Waves Nicky to answer the phone and supports her interaction with Vosen.
Checks security monitors, reloads gun, prepares to shoot an intruder but hesitates and correctly identifies it as an ally (Nicky).
Uses speakerphone to communicate through Nicky to gather information and potentially influence the hub, showing strategic thinking and situational awareness.
Maintains calm and control in a high-stakes situation holding a gun to Nicky, showing situational awareness and patience.
Engages in direct communication with Nicky, demonstrating effective use of limited information (asks how much time he has).
Uses emergency phone to call for help upon hearing gunfire, communicates clearly and calmly despite being worked up.
Fires shots into the ceiling after calling emergency, showing control and attempt to manage situation.
Moves Nicky to safety calmly and deliberately.
Efficiently travels from Gibraltar to Morocco and passes through customs without issue.
Enters a shabby room and promptly assesses it by tossing his backpack on the bed, indicating readiness and alertness.
Collaborates smoothly with Nicky as she hacks into the system, showing teamwork and reliance on technical skills.
Shows concern about Daniels's fate and instructs to find out who is targeting him.
Focuses on tactical information and information gathering with little expressed empathy in interactions.
Maintains focused surveillance on Desh to ensure he does not get harmed or lost.
Brushes past the driver and takes the key without confrontation or violence.
Remains undetected and continues to make progress despite being pursued by multiple skilled operatives.
Is implicated by enemy operatives who show concern about his movements and connections (e.g., Vosen wanting to eliminate him and Parsons).
Taking down policemen blocking his path to escape; demonstrating quick strategic thinking under pressure.
Leaping on a kid's moped and putting the kid at risk of being caught in a police dragnet.
Desperately trying to call Nicky for help, showing reliance on trusted ally.
Dismantling the phone instinctively, scattering its components.
Picking up the pace on the moped when police cars nearly catch him.
Choosing a narrow alley to escape the police cars.
Observing the environment carefully, noting police presence on foot and the crowded streets.
Recognizing the need to get higher vantage point and running up stairs.
Methodically moving through riads, courtyards, alleys, and rooftops to close the gap on Desh.
Momentarily hesitates, wondering if he has misjudged the situation.
Noticing Nicky's danger, moving quickly to reach her and protect her from Desh and the police.
Dips into a corner to prepare for combat, showing tactical focus over immediate interpersonal connection.
Navigates through a building with sleeping children and a family resting, implicitly trying to avoid direct harm to innocents.
Moves quickly and stealthily through the riad, anticipating enemy movements and maintaining awareness of surroundings under pressure.
Uses a mirror to get line of sight without exposing himself, demonstrating tactical ingenuity.
Responds immediately to signals from Nicky and adapts to rapidly changing circumstances such as police arrival and enemy engagement.
Strangles Desh in brutal fight, hides his body with Nicky to fake their deaths.
Allows Nicky to touch his shoulder, showing a moment of tenderness and reassurance though he does not fully respond.
Scrubs blood from his hands silently, showing internal struggle but no verbal or overt emotional expression.
Mentions he can see all the faces but can't remember any names, indicating possible emotional distance or detachment.
Scrubs blood from his hands carefully and remains composed under emotional stress, showing control and presence of mind.
Does not react emotionally to Nicky's reassurance touch, indicating strong self-discipline and emotional regulation.
Expresses difficulty remembering names, indicating a potential gap in memory or information recall relevant to his operations.
Sits with Nicky, shows vulnerability by admitting he tries to apologize for his killings but feels it doesn't make it better.
Warns Nicky that enemies will come for her and tells her she has to run, showing protective concern.
Engages in a meaningful, silent exchange of looks with Nicky before she leaves, conveying a deep, sincere connection.
Slips the morgue attendant a bribe.
Finds a nearly destroyed piece of paper with critical information and uses a bribe to gain access or cooperation.
Moves through a crowded airport confidently, aware that he might be under observation but maintains control of the situation.
Calls Landy first, initiating contact and prompting a rare apology from her.
Uses monocular to spy on Vosen's file covertly without confrontation.
Cuts off conversation abruptly with 'Good-bye' after Landy's off-the-record comment.
Calls Vosen unexpectedly and confidently, demonstrating control in the interaction without aggression or hostility.
Gains access to Vosen's safe by covert means without confrontation, showing calculated detachment rather than trust or friendliness.
Successfully locates and retrieves sensitive documents from a highly secure safe without detection.
Recognizes the urgency and escapes immediately, adjusting behavior to avoid capture as sirens activate.
Cuts to the south side of the road to avoid being an easy target, controls the car to make it hard for enemies to shoot accurately.
Responds quickly and skillfully to aggressive pursuit by CRI cars, evading capture by using speed and maneuvering through traffic and city terrain.
Breaks car windows to trigger alarms as a distraction while escaping.
Focuses on evading capture with urgency and tactfulness, showing no concern for damage caused.
Pulls a downed police officer into cover, calls for backup on the radio, and applies a makeshift tourniquet to the officer's wound before handing back the radio.
Rips a piece of his sweater off and ties a makeshift tourniquet for the officer, then returns the officer's radio
Uses police radio to alert an NYPD officer, enabling a timely intervention against pursuers.
Lowers gun on Paz after a violent car crash instead of killing him, then disappears.
Using the crashing chaos to his advantage, kicks out a police car window, arms himself quickly, and points a gun at his enemy Paz.
Despite having a gun aimed at Paz, he lowers it and disappears, showing strategic restraint and ability to evade capture.
Emerges into the crowded street headed uptown decisively, showing purposeful movement towards a target.
Headed directly towards Dr. Hirsch at the hospital, showing purposeful and confident movement toward a key target location.
Acknowledges Landy's concern and gives her the black bag for the mission
Refuses Landy's offer to accompany him into the hospital, insisting to face it alone
Insists on entering the hospital alone despite Landy's offer to accompany him, demonstrating confidence and resolve.
Possesses and hands over a black bag containing crucial information necessary to stop ongoing covert operations.
Shows clear understanding of the significance of '415' as a code linked to his past trauma and to the operation he aims to end.
Does not hesitate or display doubt about confronting the situation where 'it started' for him, indicating decisiveness.
Violently grabs Hirsch and slams him against the wall while aggressively searching him for weapons
Uses Hirsch’s real name 'David' indicating a personal connection and vulnerability
Reflects silently on his past voluntary service and the moment he handed over his dog tags
Physically subdues Hirsch, searches him for weapons decisively, and confronts him with confidence.
Displays momentary confusion about his identity but maintains focus in interrogation.
Recalls specific details from past training (keypad, room in use sign) during interrogation, signaling strong memory and situational awareness.
Shows vulnerability by expressing uncertainty about why he volunteered, indicating a gap in self-understanding.
Acknowledges his prodigy skills in languages and marksmanship as highlighted by Hirsch.
Accepts his role and identity as Jason Bourne despite internal conflict.
Raises a gun to Hirsch showing emotional conflict but retains control over his actions.
Questions the morality of his missions and expresses doubt, saying he was turned into a killer not a savior.
Volunteers and commits to a dangerous program with grave consequences, indicating resolve and acceptance of responsibility.
Shows signs of emotional stress and exhaustion (no sleep, looks terrible), which may impair performance.
Stares at what he's done after shooting a hooded figure.
Says to Hirsch, 'No. You don't deserve the star they give you on the wall at Langley.' (refusing to kill him despite provocation).
Flees and shoots out observation window to escape agents.
Swiftly gets to his feet and fires multiple times, killing a hooded figure decisively.
Remembers everything about his past and his identity, showing clear self-awareness.
Calmly refuses to kill Hirsch, showing control and discernment rather than rash violence.
Plans and executes an escape by shooting a mirrored observation window and diving through it while under fire, demonstrating quick thinking and physical skill.
Runs rapidly across a roof and assesses a dangerous jump or escape route from a high level, showing situational awareness and courage.
Looks at Paz holding a gun and questions his motives, implying concern about what Paz is being forced to do.
Turns and runs off the roof to escape rather than shooting or harming Paz.
Survives an almost impossible fall from the fourteenth floor of a CIA facility into the East River and swims away underwater.
Buys a newspaper, enters the station, and boards the Eurostar calmly and purposefully.
Provides a clear, specific meeting location (Waterloo Station, south entrance) and imposes a condition to talk alone, showing control and confidence.
Initiates contact purposefully via phone, maintains anonymity until necessary, and ends call decisively, indicating strategic communication.
Observes surroundings carefully and quickly forms a plan based on visual cues.
Provides precise, calm, and clear instructions to Ross under pressure.
Relies on subtle behavioral clues and environment to make tactical decisions.
Warns Ross that whoever is following him is trouble.
Responds to Ross' plea for help by moving him through a crowd and giving tactical directions to evade pursuers.
Does not engage in emotional reassurance or open communication, focusing instead on immediate survival and tactical movement.
Hesitates and measures the choice between two staircases leading to different tube lines, showing careful consideration of options.
Pursues PAZ through crowded platforms and tube station, keeping up the chase despite losing direct sight, demonstrating persistence and situational awareness.
Attempts to lunge onto the train after PAZ but the doors close before he can get in, indicating a slight failure in timing or execution.
Observes PAZ closely, recognizing his physical state and relating it to his own past, showing insight and analytical skill.
Remembers critical details about Daniels and Treadstone, despite memory loss.
Does not ask Nicky to finish her sentence about his past torture, showing restraint and control.
Quickly decides to leave the cafe when Spanish cops enter, showing situational awareness.
Expresses confusion and memory gaps about his past.
Observes Nicky working on the computer and requests to find out who is targeting Daniels after realizing the location is being blocked.
Acts calmly and strategically by instructing Nicky to deceive Desh by telling him about a new phone in order to gather intelligence.
Speaks fluent Spanish, quickly formulates a plan while surrounded by police, and checks his watch for timing.
Decisively breaks away from police control, uses physical skill to take down pursuers, and improvises by stealing a kid’s moped to escape.
Attempts to call Nicky while evading police, showing multi-tasking under pressure and resourcefulness in obtaining a dial tone despite chaotic conditions.
Line to Nicky goes dead after initial attempt to warn her, signaling a potential communication failure outside his direct control but no indication he anticipated backup plans.
Persistently tailing Desh and Nicky through crowded streets and rooftops, showing focused determination but no direct interaction or expression of concern.
Uses a monocular to zoom in on a file Vosen is examining and identifies the word 'Blackbriar.'
Initiates a phone call to Landy, knowing it would provoke a strong reaction from Vosen and others.
Gets line of sight on Vosen and his team, indicating tactical awareness and stealth.
Takes the sensitive 'TREADSTONE: Blackbriar' folder from Vosen's safe and leaves quietly without confrontation or harm.
Smashes multiple car windows, causing multiple alarms to go off.
Hotwires a car swiftly and uses it aggressively to escape agents.
Waits calmly despite being cornered and heavily outnumbered, confusing his pursuers.
Expertly hotwires the car by reaching under the dash and yanking wires off the steering column.
Uses the collision with another car to free the locked steering wheel and quickly pulls out into lane.
Waits still while heavily armed agents approach and surround him, appearing to hesitate or not immediately react.
Escapes by jumping his car off the rooftop parking lot, disappearing from sight before agents can react.
Cuts off a driver to commandeer a car and continues to evade his pursuers despite being heavily pursued and shot at.
Speaks honestly to Hirsch about his amnesia and the moment he chose not to execute Wombosi, revealing his internal conflict.
Confronts Hirsch with a gun but is open to dialogue, showing restraint and willingness to communicate.
Maintains guarded, cautious behavior indicated by gun readiness and focus on his own identity recovery.
Bourne assesses the situation quickly and decides to back up to get a running leap over a 10-foot supporting wall to reach the water below.
Upon seeing Paz aiming a gun at him, Bourne remains calm, engages verbally questioning Paz's motives instead of panicking.
Bourne turns and runs off the roof despite the immediate threat, demonstrating decisiveness and confidence.
Bourne jumps/falls fourteen stories into the freezing river, executing a dangerous escape maneuver.
Underwater, Bourne uses a dead man's float to conserve energy and manage sinking instead of flailing, showing controlled and skilled behavior.
